Package renderer

Class RayTracerBasic

java.lang.Object
renderer.RayTracerBase
renderer.RayTracerBasic
public class RayTracerBasic
extends RayTracerBase
Rey tracer calculate the color ray-geometry intersection
Author:
Noam Shushan

      private static final int MAX_CALC_COLOR_LEVEL
      The max level of the recursion attending to get
      reflection and transparency of the geometries that goes to other geometries

      private static final double MIN_CALC_COLOR_K
      The minimal effect of a color factor for transparency and reflection
      Below that there are no longer any color differences

      Trace the ray and calculates the color of the point that interact with the geometries of the scene

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the color of the object that the ray is interact with

      Returns:

    • calcColor

      private Color calcColor​(Intersectable.GeoPoint geoPoint, Ray ray)
      According to the pong model This model is additive in which we connect all the components that will eventually make up an image with background colors, self-colors and texture colors.
      Parameters:
      geoPoint - the geometry and the lighted point at him
      ray - the ray that goes out of the camera
      Returns:
      the color at the point

    • calcColor

      private Color calcColor​(Intersectable.GeoPoint geoPoint, Ray ray, int level, double k)
      overload methode of calcColor(GeoPoint, Ray)
      Parameters:
      geoPoint - the geometry and the lighted point at him
      ray - the ray that goes out of the camera
      level - the level of the recursion
      k - Represents influencing factors of transparency and reflection
      Returns:
      the color at the point

    • calcLocalEffects

      private Color calcLocalEffects​(Intersectable.GeoPoint intersection, Ray ray, double k)
      Computer lighting effects as at a certain point on geometry
      Parameters:
      intersection - the geometry and the lighted point at him
      ray - the ray from the camera
      k - Represents influencing factors of transparency and reflection
      Returns:
      the total color at the point including the specular and diffusive

    • calcGlobalEffects

      private Color calcGlobalEffects​(Intersectable.GeoPoint geoPoint, Ray inRay, int level, double k)
      Computer influences factors of transparency and reflection
      Parameters:
      geoPoint - the geometry and the lighted point at him
      inRay - the ray that goes out of the camera
      level - the level of the recursion
      k - Represents influencing factors of transparency and reflection
      Returns:
      the color with the transparency and reflection

    • calcGlobalEffectOfBean

      private Color calcGlobalEffectOfBean​(java.util.List<Ray> bean, int level, double kx, double kkx)
      calc global effects Of bean of rays
      Parameters:
      bean - the bean of rays
      level - the level of the recursion
      kx - Represents influencing factors of transparency and reflection, can be kT or kS
      kkx - effect of a color factor for transparency and reflection
      Returns:
      the average color of the bean

    • constructRefractedBean

      private java.util.List<Ray> constructRefractedBean​(Intersectable.GeoPoint geoPoint, Ray inRay)
      Produces a transparency bean of rays that starts from the point where the ray hit from the camera and goes in the direction almost like the original beam
      Parameters:
      geoPoint - the point where the ray hit from the camera
      inRay - the ray from the camera
      Returns:
      transparency ray

    • constructReflectedBean

      private java.util.List<Ray> constructReflectedBean​(Intersectable.GeoPoint geoPoint, Ray inRay)
      Produces a reflection bean that starts from the point where the ray struck from the camera and goes diagonally to the point
      Parameters:
      geoPoint - the point where the ray hit from the camera
      inRay - the ray from the camera
      Returns:
      a reflection ray

    • transparency

      private double transparency​(LightSource lightSource, Vector l, Intersectable.GeoPoint geoPoint)
      At each point of intersection A of a ray from the camera with geometry we create a new ray that is sent from A to the light source to check if another geometry is blocking us. If so it means that there is a shadow on A and therefore the point A should be painted in shadow colors.
      Parameters:
      lightSource - light source of the scene
      l - the direction of the light to the point where its strikes
      geoPoint - the geometry and the lighted point at him
      Returns:
      The total amount of transparency in order to get a more accurate shadow as a number between 0 and 1. 1 means that there is no shadow. 0 means full shadow.

    • calcSpecular

      private Color calcSpecular​(double ks, Vector l, Vector n, double nl, Vector v, double nShininess, Color lightIntensity)
      Calculates the color of the specular light as part of a pong model
      Parameters:
      ks - Percentage of energy going towards the part of the specular
      l - direction of the light to the point on the geometry
      n - the normal vector of the geometry
      nl - the angle between the normal and the direction from the light to the point
      v - the direction from the camera to the point
      nShininess - The amount of shininess that goes from the object in which the light strikes
      lightIntensity - light intensity from the light source
      Returns:
      the color of the specular light

    • calcDiffusive

      private Color calcDiffusive​(double kd, double nl, Color lightIntensity)
      Calculates the color of the diffusive light as part of a pong model
      Parameters:
      kd - Percentage of energy going towards the part of the diffusive
      nl - the angle between the normal and the direction from the light to the point
      lightIntensity - light intensity from the light source
      Returns:
      the color of the diffusive light
